name: Calabash Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been coming to Grenada for the past 8 years and love the island. When our original hotel closed down, we searched for a new place to stay. Are we glad we found the Calabash. It's a delightful small hotel for people looking to have some peace and quiet. The surroundings are lush, the breakfasts are served on your balcony every morning (at the time you request).
reviews.title: Already planning our third visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is always professional and very friendly. We've made friends with several of them over the past 2 years.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, relaxing, excellent food, good location, quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach area is very nice. Yes, there is grass in the water, but that isn't such a big deal. The water is pretty calm and there is some snorkeling along by the rocky wall. Since the property is relatively small, there are no crowds on the beach.
reviews.title: Splendid Relaxing Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were recently renovated, which has made the property even nicer. A great place for a romantic vacation.
reviews.title: Bad value for money

reviews.text: Of note, this isn't the best property for families with young children or people who want non-stop action. They do provide entertainment in the high season (and sometimes in the low season). The concierge also arranges tours and sailing trips, which were very enjoyable. We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: a little piece of paradise on earth

reviews.text: Our family of five just got back from an 8 night stay at the Calabash over Christmas, 2006. It was Perfect!!. It is a small hotel on a large lot. The rooms/villas (only 27 total rooms) are located in a horseshoe shape around a large grassy area. The main restaurant is in the back of the U and all the rooms face the beach. There is an open air restaurant on the beach where we ate lunch most days.
reviews.title: We give the Calabash a 10
The cracker
reviews.text: Every aspect of the Calabash is first class. The rooms are elegant and well appointed. The baths are large and recently renovated. The gardens around the hotel are meticulously maintained. We had a pool villa and a standard villa. Our pool was small but perfect for a quick dip or for sunbathing on the chaise lounges at the poolside. The pool is 100% private.

Each evening we selected our breakfast from a comprehensive menu. You select four or five choices (i.e. fresh fruit, eggs, juice, cereal, pancakes) and your maid serves breakfast on your private patio at the time you select.
reviews.title: Fabulous family vacation

likes.liked: — All needs available in contained area - beach, restaurant and lovely room all close
likes.disliked: — They didn't have a kids menu so I had to improvise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dive with ScubaTech. I have been diving all over the world and would compare this group favorably with anywhere I have been. The owners have only recently taken over but from all indications know the business very well. They took great care with all the divers and safety and comfort always came first.
reviews.title: Lovely Place, Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the beach is small. It is at the end of a cove where many sailboats anchor. These coves rarely have a good reef but the cove is protected and calm. There is a bit of grass on the bottom but the hotel removes the grass on a weekly basis. Since the hotel only holds 56 guests, there is never a problem getting a beach chair, or a seat at either restaurant.
reviews.title: Unforgetable

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here June 2005 when i was recovering from a torn achilles and so less mobile than usual.The hotel was superbly run,staff excellent and the manager and owner made us very welcome.Food was delightful and varied.
reviews.title: Oasis of tranquility
Good Hotel, Great Food
reviews.text: Beach good,very quiet location.Swimming from the beach excellent though snorkelling not possible but a very good dive-club on site.

reviews.title: Elegant resort and superb restaurant
reviews.text: Taxi-drivers helpful--Welcome Cummings was our main man and became a friend--great guy,ask for him.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an amazing stay. The staff went out of its way to make sure our stay was as pleasant as possible. They went above and beyond to meet our needs and prepare special memories and gift that were sent to us. This was part of our honeymoon and we could have not asked for a better place.
reviews.title: Great service!

reviews.text: Their breakfast is to die for and dinner was spectacular.
reviews.title: Stay away if you have kids!

likes.disliked: — Not set up for families at all

reviews.text: If you have children and are looking for a great vacation spot for little ones (babies and/or toddlers) DO NOT GO TO THE CALABASH! Though they say that they make arrangements for accomodating kids, they DO NOT. We had no highchair, no crib, a second-rate playpen, and no kids menu or eating arrangements to suit little ones. Staff is friendly, but unable or unwilling to cater to the needs of young families. This is a great couples-only resort, but a HORRIBLE choice for families. Staff and other guests make you feel guilty if a child so much as giggles loudly...this is a QUIET resort and is for only those seeking peace and relaxation...beware if you have kids...I would choose the many other options for carribean resorts that REALLY ARE set-up to meet the needs of young families expertly. This resort make only a pretense.
reviews.title: Wonderful holiday

reviews.text: We stayed at the Calabash from 18/5 for 2 weeks. It was a very relaxing holiday. The staff were so friendly & helpful. Holidaymakers that we met there were great fun, the whole place had lovely atmosphere really. It made a change for it to be majority English people staying there.
reviews.title: Reality check

description: The Calabash Hotel combines five star service and luxury within a relaxed & intimate environment to create the ultimate Caribbean escape.
